climbs.name: Phil Legget
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Rhesa Ashbacher

content.description: This formation and climb are east out of the 49 Palms parking lot.  P.L. is up hill a bit and faces the parking lot. It starts in a slanting crack, goes past one bolt, then continues on natural gear up to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: Small to med. gear, and a quick draw for the bolt.
content.location: East out of the parking lot of the 49 Palm Oasis trailhead.

content.description: Climb directly up the face keeping to the right of Phil Legget. Excellent rock on these routes.
content.location: This route is located immeadiately to the right of Phil Legget.

content.description: Climb the arete just to the right of Apply Directly to the Forehead.
content.location: This route is just to the right of Apply Directly to the Forehead.

content.description: Start around to the left of Apply Directly to the Forehead on the north side of the same boulder. From atop a boulder, climb up and slighty right on pretty good holds to the summit.
content.location: Start around to the left of Apply Directly to the Forehead on the north side of the same boulder.

content.description: This route is on the large boulder due east from the parking lot and very obvious.  From what I understand, Mike Paul and friends climbed this boulder years ago, and there was a bolted anchor on top for a top rope set up. There is now a lead climb on this boulder, it it goes up the west face which faces the parking lot.
content.protection: Quick Draws only. Bolted anchor on top.
content.location: Due east out of the parking lot is this obvious boulder. The route has 2 or 3 bolts and faces the parking lot.

climbs.name: An Erection Lasting Longer Than 4 Hours

content.description:
This climb is located on a small buttress on the hillside, behind a new watertank, up on the hillside, in the town of 29 Palms, just west of Stater Brothers but east of

the 49 Palms turn off...... from  the main highway.  It is not on the biggest main gray colored face, but a buttress left of the main face.    ( We tried to TR the main

face, which has a slanting thin crack on it, but we were unsuccessful;  probably 5.11+).  The climb goes up a steep buttress past 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Off the main highway just before the Stater Brothers market in 29 Palms. Fromation easily seen from the highway. Maybe (probably) not in the Nat. Park.

climbs.name: 10 Hits of Window Pane
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Will Strickland,  Blitzo

content.description: This climb is visible on the drive into the 49 Palms parking area.  Just before you reach the parking lot, you can see a ridge of climbing rock off to the south of the parking lot.   Hike up the 49 Palms trail only for a few minutes, then cut off to the right and hike past a huge eggs shaped boulder with a steep dike on it   (Project;  2 bolts on top and has been tried on a TR......5.11+?...we couldn't do it....).  Keep hiking all the way to the furthest right climbable rock, and you will find this climb.  It is still down low, and only maybe 5-10 min. from the parking lot.   The climb goes up past one bolt, then some natural gear, then past another bolt or two near the top to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: a few small to med. cams, and a few quick draws.
content.location: Not far off the 49 Palms Oasis trail, down and to the right. This cliffband is very visible as you drive in to the parking area, but not visible from the parking area.
